Key Match Events: England dominated possession and territory but lacked penetration and quality in scoring opportunities
Declan Rice made a fine reverse pass to get Phil Foden in up the left, but Foden was pulled back for offside
Kobbie Mainoo made a difference after coming on at half-time, showing composure and readiness to get into dangerous areas
Pre-Game Insights: Fans were expecting a performance to reinvigorate their team after the toil of their opening Euro 2024 ties against Serbia and Denmark
England needed to move the ball with slickness, a major failing against Denmark
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate heard loud jeers and had cups thrown down at him after the match
The crowd felt that Southgate and the players had not done enough to win the match
Southgate has always had a happy knack with tournament draws, but this time his team finds themselves on the other side of the draw to France, Spain, Germany, and Portugal
Miscellaneous Highlights: The England fans' party ended in boos as the team turned the clock back
Slovenia players celebrated reaching the last 16 in stark contrast to the howls at the other end
The atmosphere among the 18,000 England fans was something special, but the goal did not come
Others: England qualified on top of Group C after Denmark's draw against Serbia and will now face a yet-to-be-determined third-place finisher in the last 16
The Netherlands, Romania, Belgium, Slovakia, or Ukraine are possible opponents in the last 16
